page.title: 06CANVEY'S SEA WALL
page.content: { Canvey is an island which is surrounded by the river Thames. The river is tidal,which means that the tide rises and falls every 12 hours. Every 25 years or so there is a freak high tide, and there has been a danger that London will be flooded. However, now that the London Barrier is working, then Canvey had to be protected too. This meant that the local sea walls had to be rebuilt. The old walls were not thick or high enough. The new sea defences are much higher and stronger. The walls are thicker at the bottom than at the top. They are made of gigantic concrete blocks,which fit together like a jigsaw. The joints are sealed with tar.The top of the wall is curved towards the sea,so that high waves will be rolled back into the sea.
